objects.text:
Dear all,

  

Good news! MIT Ventureships Club is providing a great opportunity for you to
gain experience in both entrepreneurship and leadership!

  

Every semester, our club works with MIT Venture Mentoring Service to launch a
Ventureships Program. In this program, we interview and select 4~5 early stage
MIT start-ups as well as 10~20 MIT students. The students will work closely
with the CEOs on market research, fund raising, technology development, etc,
all of which are essential to the start-ups.

  

As the Spring 2015 Ventureships Program is approaching, we are recruiting new
members into our executive board.

  

**Position Info And Requirements:**

1) We are looking for 4~5 new members, and according to club regulation, new
member will start as Program Coordinators.

2) Program Coordinator description:

**a) **Will join a team in the Ventureships Program and work on the CEO's project together with other  students in the team. 3~5 hours/week.

**b) **Will coordinate the students and CEO in his/her team as the representative of the Club.

**c) **Responsible directly to the President. 

**d) **Can take on other positions such as Treasurer, Vice President, Publicity Director, etc.

**e) **Will be present in the video of the Club, which will be posted in all our promotion tools.

**f) **Will get a certificate at the end of semester.

**g)** Possible opportunities to be further involved in the start-up he/she works with.

  

If you are enthusiastic about entrepreneurship, don't hesitate to join us!

Apply here:

http://goo.gl/forms/HjLir9ck5O

  

**Join our mailing list**, so that you can receive up-to-date information of the club:

https://mailman.mit.edu:444/mailman/listinfo/ventureships_enthusiasts

  

Questions can be sent to ventureships_executive@exchange.mit.edu

  

Links to the Club:  
http://ventureships.mit.edu  
https://www.facebook.com/groups/228347817286309/  
http://www.linkedin.com/groups/MIT-Ventureships-
Club-4569007?gid=4569007&trk=hb_side_g

  

Ventureships Executive Board

View Online in Web Browser

##  2.0 Project

Work on the FWD.us online advocacy tools with a team of in-house engineers and
volunteer coders. Join a team of problem solvers and strategists who want to
use their specialized skills to shape the national narrative on critical
political issues in local chapter areas.

**Ideal Volunteer:**

  * Digital campaign or marketing experience
  * Have professional experience in Ruby on Rails and/or HTML
  * Have an understanding of APIs
  * Be mission driven with a passion for the intersection of tech and politics
  * Be interested in and supportive of comprehensive immigration reform

Apply here: http://www.fwd.us/two
